about.summary: Encryption wrappers, using low-level support from 'sodium' and 'openssl'.  'cyphr' tries to smooth over some pain points when using encryption within applications and data analysis by wrapping around differences in function names and arguments in different encryption providing packages.  It also provides high-level wrappers for input/output functions for seamlessly adding encryption to existing analyses.

name: r-cyphr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '1.0.1' %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-cyphr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/cyphr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/cyphr/cyphr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: f0cb75eb663c79182ea289629f9996d008d42827bbfd259247c18cc683cf16ea

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip  # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-getpass
    - r-openssl >=0.9.9
    - r-sodium
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-getpass
    - r-openssl >=0.9.9
    - r-sodium

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('cyphr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('cyphr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ropensci/cyphr
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Encryption wrappers, using low-level support from 'sodium' and 'openssl'.  'cyphr'
    tries to smooth over some pain points when using encryption within applications
    and data analysis by wrapping around differences in function names and arguments
    in different encryption providing packages.  It also provides high-level wrappers
    for input/output functions for seamlessly adding encryption to existing analyses.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - ocefpaf
